result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with revocation sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact direct or indirect with victim's family as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher S Anderson in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Christopher S Anderson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders Defendant to submit DNA sample if one hasn't already been done. Defendant indicates he's previously been convicted of a felony and has already submitted a DNA sample to the State.  State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant apologizes to the victims family. Court makes statement to defendant, imposes sentence.  Bond no longer in effect.
to Transport

Defendant Christopher S Anderson appeared by video from Fox Lake. Attorney George Steve Pappas appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. (Court can see Defendant, Defendant cannot see Judge or Counsel.) Defense requests that case be set for trial, files expert witness list. State requests 3 day trial. Defense advises that scheduling into April will work best. Discussion regarding witnesses. Motions to be filed by January 9. Discussion regarding potential trial dates (3 trial dates selected). Defense to let Court know by 12/19 if plea hearing is going.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from State to Court requesting extension to file pre-trial motions. Per Court, ok, til 3:30 pm 11/26/14.

Defendant Christopher Anderson appeared by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution. Attorney George Steve Pappas appeared in Court. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Information. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Discussion regarding what to set next. Motions due by 11/24/14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Arraignment on September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher S Anderson in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Christopher S Anderson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Defense files request for substitution of judge. Court approves request. Arraignment will be set when new judge is assigned.
